relationships.evidence_text: Welcome to the Y on Earth Community podcast. Today we have the opportunity to visit with Eric Lombardi.

relationships.target: zero waste and social enterprise movements
relationships.evidence_text: Eric Lombardi has been working at the cutting edge of the zero waste and social enterprise movements across the world since the mid-1990s.

evidence.target_surface: zero waste and social enterprise movements

relationships.target: zero waste organization in the United States
relationships.evidence_text: He was a national spokesperson for the first zero waste organization in the United States in 1997.

evidence.target_surface: zero waste organization in the United States

relationships.evidence_text: was a co-founder of the zero waste international alliance in 2002.
Eric was invited to the Clinton White House in 1998 as one of the top 100 USA recyclers.

relationships.relationship: received a Lifetime Achievement Award from
relationships.evidence_text: received a Lifetime Achievement Award from the Colorado Association for Recycling.
he turned a small nonprofit called Ecocycle into the largest zero waste social enterprise in the United States.

relationships.evidence_text: Eric is now working as an associate to the social enterprise world forum.
promoting hybrid business structures to achieve zero waste zero carbon communities.
Eric holds a master's degree in technology and human affairs from Washington University in St. Louis.
Eric holds a master's degree in technology and human affairs from Washington University in St. Louis.
and I started studying solar energy.
got my first solar job in 1980.
then I went into water conservation work.
then I went into waste recycling.
